title: Critical Theory and Mathematics Learning Design: Webinar-Based Discussion Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Knowledge in Mathematics Education and Understanding of Secondary Curriculum
context.additional_context: Webinar-based discussion course conducted in smartphone-centric restricted technological environments. Learners explore applying critical theories to mathematics learning design, emphasizing research competencies considering educational contexts' social dimensions.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze at least three critical theory frameworks for designing mathematics curricula.
Learners present case studies applying critical perspectives to math learning design with peer feedback via webinar discussions.
Learners design at least two math learning strategies to address educational inequality using mobile-accessible microlearning resources.

resources: Introductory Critical Theory Video (5 minutes or less)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
